page.title: 16Daventry Radio Station.
page.content: Today (1985) Senior transmitter Manager, Maurice Williamson, has a staff of 60 to run a site of some 250 acres on which stand four steel towers reaching to 350 feet and 40 masts standing up to 500 feet. There are 14 "Senders" (as the BBC calls the powerful machines) that pump out the signal to the aerial displays (47 in all) that are strung between the towers and masts. On the hill there are 18 lattice steel masts from 150-500 ft tall. 4 steel towers from 115-365 feet, 22 tubular masts from 80-150 feet, 13 single band, 30 dual band, one four band and three Rhombics make a total of 47 aerials covering all the H.F. broadcast bands from 4 to 26 MHz. All arrays are directional with reversible reflectors, giving the station the capability of broadcasting to the world
